Topic.Title: Yahoo NOT deleting reported scam posts!

Message.Msg: Yahoo has bigger problems than the functionality, look/feel of their finance message boards. By deleting urls which link to contrarian analysis, particularly of pink sheet fraud promoters WHILE allowing both the spam bots and the actual paid advertising from the stock shill firms Yahoo potentially opens itself to being joined as a recovery defendant for any tout firm hit with a civil suit. Step 1: Yahoo advertiser penalized in SEC action. Step 2: Yahoo records reveal suppression of message board postings against that advertiser (Yahoo facilitates their activities as it were) at this point whether it's automated or discretionary is irrelevant. Step 3: Plaintiffs, recognizing that the touts are long gone and damages unrecoverable, attempts to join Yahoo in the "I"ve been swindled" case. Step 4: ?? Winning isn't everything, sometimes just shining a bright light can be cringe worthy. Bottom Line: Enabling the stock fraud promoters while silencing the MB critics is a risk I wouldn't want my management to take Less

Message.Title: The Motley fool writes......Goog vs yhoo
Message.Msg: Yahoo has extensive assets that top engineers can make much better use of. Some of its sections, like Finance, are already better than those at Google, many cloud technologies were actually invented there, and Mayer wisely didn't sell all her Alibaba stake, meaning that after that company comes public – perhaps later this year – there will be new opportunities to cross-promote, perhaps even bringing Alibaba's Chinese pricing to American shoppers. This could be very BIG for Yahoo. What do you think ?
